My hubby had the lamb chops, and he loved them. It came with one side I think (he got asparagus).  He also got an extra side of penne in garlic oil because he felt like he needed the starch for the lamb chop's sauce.  It was swimming in sauce.  Lamb chops were cooked perfectly.

The highlight of my meal was the chocolate mousse cake.  Server said the chef's wife makes them (along with the rum cake abd tiramisu).  It was perfect consistency and sweetness (not too sweet).  The place is pricey,  but I would recommend it for date night.  My hubby's makers mark and diet coke were $10 ea, but that's up and coming Lawrenceville for ya.  Overall, would go back but not a weekly thing.

I was surprised to see that the other reviews for Matteo's are so low--and then I realized that they are 5+ years old and both based on the fact that a tour bus was served before the reviewers because the bus driver called their orders in ahead of time. I've never experienced anything like that, and the tour packages don't stop there anymore, so problem solved.  Now on to the food, service, etc...

I came here with my mom for breakfast on Sunday morning, and we had a lovely time.  There are a few tables on the front patio, and we snagged one, which offered a nice view of old town and the historic hotel where the restaurant is based.  My corned beef hash was delicious--definitely homemade--and when I order it without eggs (I'm allergic), they knocked several dollars off the price without my asking. Our server was nice and prompt, and we both enjoyed our meals.

If you are looking for a nice breakfast in a pleasant environment (you can also wander the little shops inside the hotel and a couple of nearby blocks), Matteo's is a good bet.  It's also one of the few places in town that has pleasant outdoor seating and allows (well-behaved) dogs on the patio.  I cannot personally vouch for lunch, but I have heard positive things about that menu as well.

Also, many people have given glowing reviews of this restaurant on the Yelp page for the Boulder Dam Hotel: http://www.yelp.com/biz/boulder-dam-hotel-boulder-city.  If you factor those in, Matteo's gets much better reviews than this page shows.  I would definitely recommend it.

Went here today for a late lunch date with my hubby. 

There were a few tables occupied, but it was not slammed. When I walked in I noticed a specials board outside that mentioned crab ravioli with a saffron cream sauce. It sounded so delicious, that nothing else was going to come up to scratch. 

When we asked the waitress about the dish she continued the description by mentioning that it would be topped with a Jonah Crab Claw which sold me on it. Though it was the most expensive dish on the lunch menu ($28) it was worth every penny. The ravioli was stuffed full of crab and no other filler, and the sauce was heavenly and we took advantage of the bread to soak it up. The crab claw, ended up being 4 big crab claws. It was amazing! 

My husband decided to go with the linguine primavera in alfredo sauce with chicken. This dish was delicious, and the pasta was perfectly cooked. The chicken was also perfectly cooked and a large portion for an add on. The one thing I will say is that the alfredo sauce wasn't the cheesiest, but I think the lightness of the sauce enhanced the dish. 

We don't eat carbs that often, and when we were leaving we said that this "cheat" was worth it!

We will definitely be back when we are ready for some serious carb heaven!

I want to write this very carefully. I came in for restaurant week, so I expected it to be bustling. From a previous experience I also expected it to be good, but it was not. 

We came on Friday and it was packed. I felt like our server and the kitchen seemed overwhelmed. We waited a good amount of time between our wine, receiving bread and our courses. Not that I mind staggering things, but especially the wine and bread should have been out quicker. The bread was fresh and piping hot, so that settled the rumbling stomachs once we got it.

I ordered the special of mussels in tomato sauce, Ceasar salad and polenta crusted cod. The mussels were okay. I wasn't thrilled with the sauce, as it seemed a bit bland. The salad was totally fine. But the cod, inedible. 

Now I will say, I felt very badly about saying something, but I wasn't going to eat it. It was mushy and the tomato sauce also seemed to not be seasoned. I took one bite and was done. The server didn't seem to concerned, but did exchange my meal for the tortellini. While that was much better, the experience had already been ruined. 

I must admit, I was surprised that a manager didn't pop in to ask if everything was okay. Especially since two of our four meals had been sent back. I also saw the chef pop out twice and he also never said a word to us. I just thought it was strange. Was it my responsibility to tell the manager? Or was it the server? I don't know, but I felt awkward about the whole experience.

My boyfriend and I order from Matteo's very often. Nice, quiet, good food. Different from a lot of the bars in the area. We've never tried anything we didn't like, and the specials are always very fun and thoughtful. Yesterday we ordered Cajun tuna alfredo and hot sausage ravioli. Some of the prices are a bit high, but good food and you'll always go home with leftovers :)
Cozy place but disappointing service. Took 30 mins to  get my drink. Can safely assume food will take an hour.

A group of friends (8) and I went to Matteo's on Friday a little after 7pm. They were very accommodating and put two tables together for us. The main reason I gave this location 4 stars instead of 5 is because of how long we had to wait for bread and our entrees. The service was very slow and we waited at least 20 minutes for bread and then at least an additional 15 minutes for our entrees. Their bread and dipping oil/sauce was delicious and their entrees were generously sized, reasonably priced, and very delicious! Overall, I'd definitely recommend coming here, but not if you are in a rush or super hungry!

I wish I could have liked the food.  The appetizer of grilled calamari was okay, it everything else that we had was just bland or didn't meet our expectations.  The decor of the plan was cute and the server was great but the food fell really short.

Where's my dipping sauce?

The service was horrendous. Came with a party of 10 and they shouldn't offer to accommodate parties if they can't handle the request. We waited 30-40 minutes for drinks. The server ignored us for nearly an hour. Our reservation was for 7, we didn't order our food until 8:15. Food came around 8:45, so it obviously wasn't the cooks fault for the poor service. The wait staff was awful. A friend ordered a drink and waited 40 minutes and the waitress' excuse as, "I ran out of hands." We are sitting right beside the bar and clearly see the drink order was never put in.  Another member in our group asked for a  cocktail and not a difficult request. The "owner" was bartending and messed up her drink not once but twice. She said she no longer wanted it and the owner at the bar directly behind us said "what's wrong with it now?!" Not a very professional owner if you ask me. 

Food was delicious, but the service took away from the experience. 

I wouldn't come here again.
